result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety with the exception of prescribed medications.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process. 

Have no contact with K.H., D.L. and R.B.Z.

Comply with the Drug Court Program.

Comply with any orders through the Department of Human Services.

Maintain full-time employment, schooling or a combination of both. 

Complete GED/HSED.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on May 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

It is hereby ordered that based upon the fact that there are sufficient safeguards in place in 22 CF 161, the $1,000.00 cash bond is hereby modified to a $1,000.00 signature bond with the same nonmonetary conditions of release.

11:31 AM Defendant Tasha Marie Harris appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Philip L Hoff for Tasha Marie Harris appeared by video, Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 
Defense has filed a motion to modify bail. Parties argue. 
The court modifies the bail to $1,000 personal recognizance bond with the same non-monetary conditions. 
Attorney Hoff to draft the order.
Motion for Bail Modification.
Scheduling conference on May 4, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Further proceedings on April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Zoom appearances.
Defendant in custody in Manitowoc County Jail.
Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline 04-08-22
Scheduling conference is set for 05-04-22 at 10:15 a.m.
Bail motion is set for 03-09-22 at 11:00 a.m.
Minutes.
Bail/bond hearing on March 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Philip Hoff, through Public Defender.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

Defendant in custody.    
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.    Preliminary hearing is set for 03-04-22 at 1:30 p.m.    Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash bail with the conditions that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and defendant is to have no contact with Child A, B, C, & D only as permitted by Human Services Department.   Bail not furnished.   Defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.   
Minutes.
Letter from defendant requesting bond modification
